question:
On a recent holiday you lost a valuable item. Fortunately you have travel insurance to cover the cost of anything lost.

Write a letter to the manager of your insurance company. In your letter:
• Describe the item you lost
• Explain how you lost it.
• Tell the insurance company what you would like them to do.
text: I have been a loyal customer for six years and I am thankful for your decent service over the past years. I am writing this letter to inquire about coverage of my lost item.

Unfortunately, while I was on my summer holiday, I lost my bracelet which had a brown leather band with my name written with gold on it. It was a gift for my eighteenth birthday from my parents so not only it was pricy but also had a sentimental value for me. As far as I recall, I wore it at the beach party where had over a hundred guests, and the next morning, I looked everywhere but it was lost.

Hopefully, I have  insurance coverage that will pay the full price. Hence, I would appreciate it if you could provide me with your company's lost item form so I can fill and send it to you ASAP. Should you require any further information, do not hesitate to contact me.
